Internal ballistics (also interior ballistics), a subfield of ballistics, is the study of the 
propulsion of a projectile. In guns internal ballistics covers the time from the 
propellant's ignition until the projectile exits the gun barrel. The study of internal 
ballistics is important to designers and users of firearms of all types, ... Some 
energy is lost in deforming the projectile and causing it to spin.
